duties_responsibilities.duty: Process daily customer invoices and verify GL coding. Submit invoices to customers by uploading, emailing, or mailing invoices based on customer preference.
Monitor Accounts Receivable aging and perform collection activities, tracking progress and follow-up steps in collection notes.
Resolve customer issues, including short payments, promptly and accurately. Escalate issues to the supervisor and sales team as necessary.
Prepare weekly AR aging report and assist with collection cash forecast.
Verify sales order accuracy compared to customer purchase orders. Communicate with customer accounting and internal sales contacts to resolve pricing, payment terms, sales tax, and invoice issues.
Manage customer sales tax exemption and resale certificate files and verify correct sales tax on invoices.
Process customer credit card payments, scan check payments, and download electronic payment information for daily payment posting in the ERP system.
Monitor customer AR balances, credit limits and assist with periodic credit reviews.
Preparation of monthly journal entries and balance sheet reconciliations.
Assist with internal and external audits and special projects as needed.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or GED required. Associate degree in Accounting preferred.
